featured.title: MedicalVisionNet
featured.description: A deep learning framework for medical image analysis with pre-trained models for various imaging modalities including X-ray, CT, and MRI.
featured.longDescription: MedicalVisionNet is a comprehensive deep learning framework designed specifically for medical image analysis. It provides pre-trained models for a variety of imaging modalities, including X-ray, CT, and MRI scans. The framework includes tools for image preprocessing, model training, and result visualization tailored to the unique challenges of medical imaging data. It also implements state-of-the-art architectures optimized for different diagnostic tasks, from detection to segmentation.

featured.title: EHR-NLP Toolkit
featured.description: An NLP toolkit for processing and analyzing electronic health records, with capabilities for medical entity recognition, relation extraction, and automated coding.
featured.longDescription: The EHR-NLP Toolkit is a specialized natural language processing suite designed for electronic health records. It features advanced capabilities for medical entity recognition, relation extraction between medical concepts, and automated ICD coding. The toolkit includes models trained on large-scale medical text data, with specific attention to the nuances of clinical documentation. It also provides visualization tools to help clinicians and researchers interpret the extracted information from patient records.

other.title: Patient Outcome Predictor
other.description: A machine learning system for predicting patient outcomes based on clinical data, with a focus on ICU settings.

other.title: MedicalDataSynthesizer
other.description: A tool for generating synthetic medical data with privacy guarantees for training and testing healthcare AI systems.

other.title: HealthcareDataViz
other.description: Interactive visualization dashboard for healthcare metrics and patient data analysis.

other.title: BiomedicalSignalProcessor
other.description: A library for processing and analyzing biomedical signals such as ECG, EEG, and EMG.
